comments:
Create a new Remote Server and Configuration for iSeries.
Start the server in Debug mode. It just hangs. The error log shows an
exception - timeout.

If the iSeries is a V5R2, it worked ok, but it will not work on V5R1.
Both systems use WAS 5.0. I created my own instance of a WAS server.

The server can start ok in normal mode on both systems. Both iSeries have 1.3 
and 1.4 JDK installed, and the latest PTFs for JDWP.

I am using the latest WSAD 5.0.2 with eclipse 2.0.3. build 200303031612

Actually, when I start the server in debug mode and connect to the V5R2
iSeries, the job times out. But I change the java-debug communication timeout
from 3000 to 60000, then it can connect ok.
I then did the same connection to a V5R1 iSeries, but I get the
java exception as indicated below:

Rick, to address your questions:

>1) To test this out further, I wonder if there are any areas in the code
>where the wait times can be adjusted somehow. Then, can we get a patched
>driver with these new timer settings that a user can adjust?

We use one timeout value for all communications with the VM. It can be 
adjusted in one place in the UI, as a user preference (Java > Debug > 
Communication timeout).

>2) Why is this timeout exception coming across as "uncaught" anyway?
>Shouldn't the code that's waiting and eventually times out, catch the 
>exception and return gracefully? 

The exception is caught and handled in these cases - it is logged and 
processing continues. However if it always times out, it will never appear in 
the UI.

>And, when this happens to a user, shouldn't they be able to adjust the
>timeout as a setting somewhere?

As mentioned, we only surface this as a user preference (generally, there is 
no need to change it)

Do you have an Eclipse 3.0 driver that you can test with, to see if the 
problem remains, or if the same workarounds work?
marking as wontfix. please open a new bug if this continues to be an issue in newer Eclipse releases.
